Setting.Name: Low Pass Filter Signal Before Downsampling

Comment.Text: This scenario demonstrates how to do Event-Related Potentials (ERP) type visualization with OpenViBE.
A lua script is used to make an event timeline consisting of two types of trials, "Target" and "Nontarget"
Using two stream switches is a clever trick to make continuous signal by choosing segments in turns fom the two input streams.
You should see a clear difference emerge between the plots after averaging for a while.
This side computes and displays the ERP plot

We do two separate estimates: one for NonTarget and another for Target. The signal is routed accordingly.
Stimulation based epoching is configured with the trial length.

This left hand side chain here generates a 1-channel signal that is zeroes on 'NonTarget' and a phase-locked square wave pattern on 'Target'. This is analoguous e.g. to P300 where an event-related pattern emerges when user attends the target on flash and otherwise does not.
The signal does not attempt to model real EEG, but to clearly illustrate the ERP visualization.
You can browse each box' documentation by selecting the box and pressing F1
By default the Epoch Variance will do a cumulative estimate, so the ERP plot will become more and more defined as more trials come in.
Downsampling can be used to make the plot more smooth
Bury the clean signal in noise. The more trials you average, the better the ERP plot is able to show the pattern buried in noise.
